definition: lit. daily changes of temperature/fig. well-being/sb's comfort, health, prosperity etc
see 如人飲水，冷暖自知|如人饮水，冷暖自知[ru2 ren2 yin3 shui3 , leng3 nuan3 zi4 zhi1]
cooling and heating/air conditioning and central heating
the person who drinks it knows best whether the water is hot or cold (Zen proverb); self-awareness comes from within/to know best by personal experience
pinyin: ru2 ren2 yin3 shui3 , leng3 nuan3 zi4 zhi1

sentences.chinese: 冷暖自知，与本人的影子相互抚慰。

sentences.english: Therefore it provides aback-ground for the long-range forecasting of coldness and warmness in tire Bohai regio…

sentences.english: As to which more appropriate oneself, water like the person, changes in temperature from cicada.

sentences.english: In recent days the weather changes in temperature unevenness especially in the morning, please put on more clothes.

sentences.english: Then let articulate the heart become ever albatross.

sentences.english: Meeting of cold and warm air in southern China causes heavy rain in there in spring.

sentences.english: Happiness is like peeing in your pants. Everyone can see it, but only you can feel its warmth.

sentences.english: Life is a barren travel, affair, and pain in the heart.

definition: variable/changeable/fickle/impermanence (Sanskrit: anitya)/ghost taking away the soul after death/to pass away/to die
the four seasons/spring, summer, autumn and winter
coming together and separating/aggregation and dissipation
see 如人飲水，冷暖自知|如人饮水，冷暖自知[ru2 ren2 yin3 shui3 , leng3 nuan3 zi4 zhi1]
the ways of the world/social behavior
worldly affairs/the ways of the world
sour, sweet, bitter and spicy hot/fig. the joys and sorrows of life
four types of human emotions, namely: happiness 歡喜|欢喜[huan1 xi3], anger 憤怒|愤怒[fen4 nu4], sorrow 悲哀[bei1 ai1] and joy 快樂|快乐[kuai4 le4]
joys and sorrows/partings and reunions/the vicissitudes of life
